Description: Ostracon, fragment of the upper-body of a red-brown pottery ribbed vessel, the fabric is partially grey-black in section, the interior is covered with a glossy dark-brown resinous deposit, the exterior (very worn) is covered with a light-brown slip and faint traces of at least one line of Coptic text written in black ink.
Bibliographic references: Trismegistos / An interdisciplinary portal of papyrological and epigraphic resources (394867) (http://www.trismegistos.org/text/394867)
